Header: 25 bodies of foreigners killed in the attack handed over; Four Chinese scientists among them
Content: Chinas Xinhua news agency has reported that 4 Chinese scientists were killed owing to the explosions which took place on Easter Sunday. The Chinese embassy had noted that five other Chinese scientists had sustained injuries due to the explosions and measures have been taken to bring them back to China. The Chinese government has taken measures to obtain the remains of the deceased Chinese scientists. The Chinese scientists representing a scientific research institution in China had arrived in the country in April for a research. Issuing a communique on the 29th of April, the Sri Lanka ministry of foreign affairs noted that 42 foreign nationals were killed following the Easter Sunday explosions. The foreign affairs ministry further noted that the remains of 25 have been returned to their respective countries.
